title: Pattern-wise Transparent Sequential Recommendation
abstract: arXiv:2402.11480v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: A transparent decision-making process is essential for developing reliable and trustworthy recommender systems. For sequential recommendation, it means that the model can identify critical items asthe justifications for its recommendation results. However, achieving both model transparency and recommendation performance simultaneously is challenging, especially for models that take the entire sequence of items as input without screening. In this paper,we propose an interpretable framework (named PTSR) that enables a pattern-wise transparent decision-making process. It breaks the sequence of items into multi-level patterns that serve as atomic units for the entire recommendation process. The contribution of each pattern to the outcome is quantified in the probability space. tldr: 提出了一种模式透明的顺序推荐框架，通过将项目序列分解为多级模式并在概率空间中量化每个模式对结果的贡献，实现了透明的决策过程。
en_tdlr: Introduced a pattern-wise transparent sequential recommendation framework, which breaks the sequence of items into multi-level patterns and quantifies the contribution of each pattern to the outcome in probability space, achieving a transparent decision-making process.
